Mientras tanto, me quedé sentado allí, disfrutando del fresco de la noche y del silencio de la callejuela. De repente, oí el sonido de pasos detrás de mí, y me di la vuelta para ver quién era. Era un hombre mayor, con un sombrero de fieltro y un abrigo largo, que se acercaba hacia mí con una sonrisa en el rostro. Me saludó con la mano y se sentó a mi lado en el banco. "¿Qué te trae por aquí?", me preguntó, y yo le conté mi historia de cómo había estado observando la casa desde arriba. El hombre asintió con la cabeza y me dijo que él también había vivido en esa casa en su juventud, y que había conocido a la familia que la habitaba en ese momento. Me contó historias de la casa y de la familia, y yo me sentí como si estuviera viviendo en el pasado. El hombre se llamaba don Pedro, y resultó ser un hombre muy sabio y amable, que me dio consejos y me hizo preguntas sobre mi vida. Pasamos horas hablando, y cuando el sol comenzó a salir, don Pedro se despidió de mí y se fue. Me quedé sentado allí, sintiendo una sensación de paz y de conexión con la casa y con la gente que la habitaba. Me di cuenta de que la casa no era solo un lugar físico, sino un lugar lleno de historias y de recuerdos, y que cada persona que la habitaba dejaba una parte de sí misma en ella. Me levanté del banco y me fui, sintiendo que había aprendido algo importante sobre la vida y sobre mí mismo.

en_first_half: “This was quite too good to lose, Watson. I was just balancing whether I should run for it, or whether I should perch behind her landau when a cab came through the street. The driver looked twice at such a shabby fare, but
en_second_half: I jumped in before he could object. ‘The Church of St. Monica,’ said I, ‘and half a sovereign if you reach it in twenty minutes.’ It was twenty-five minutes to twelve, and of course it was clear enough what was in the wind.
en_results: his curiosity got the better of him, and he pulled up to the curb. I hastily jumped in, and we sped off into the crowded streets of London. The woman beside me didn't seem to notice my presence, lost in thought as she stared
en_results_raw: The driver looked twice at such a shabby fare, but his curiosity got the better of him, and he pulled up to the curb. I hastily jumped in, and we sped off into the crowded streets of London. The woman beside me didn't seem to notice my presence, lost in thought as she stared out the window. I watched her, intrigued by the determined look on her face, and wondered what had brought her to this part of town. As we turned a corner, she suddenly spoke up, her voice low and urgent, "Driver, stop the cab, I need to get out here." The driver pulled over, and she quickly paid him, then stepped out onto the sidewalk, disappearing into the throng of people. I was left sitting in the cab, feeling a bit bewildered, but also curious about what had just transpired. I decided to follow her, and I jumped out of the cab, weaving through the crowd to keep her in sight. She led me on a wild goose chase, darting down alleys and side streets, but I managed to keep up, my eyes fixed on her retreating figure. Finally, she ducked into a small, unassuming shop, and I followed her, my heart pounding in my chest. I pushed open the door and stepped inside, finding myself in a dimly lit room filled with the musty smell of old books and the faint scent of pipe smoke. The woman was nowhere to be seen, but a figure emerged from the shadows, a tall, gaunt man with sunken eyes and a mischievous grin. He beckoned me over, and I approached him, feeling a sense of trepidation. "Welcome, Mr. Holmes," he said, his voice low and gravelly. "I've been expecting you." I was taken aback, unsure of how he knew my name, but before I could ask any questions, he continued, "I see you're quite the detective, Mr. Holmes. I have a case that requires your unique skills." I was intrigued, and my mind began to race with possibilities. What could this case be, and what did this enigmatic figure have in store for me? I nodded, eager to hear more, and the man began to explain, his words spilling out in a rapid-fire pace. "It's a matter of great importance, Mr. Holmes. A valuable artifact has gone missing, and I fear it's in the wrong hands. I need you to track it down and retrieve it for me." I listened intently, my mind working overtime to piece together the details. The man handed me a small, intricately carved box, and I took it, feeling a surge of excitement. This was going to be a challenge, but I was ready for it. I was ready to take on the case, and see where it would lead me.

Mientras tanto, mi mente estaba en un torbellino de pensamientos. ¿Qué había pasado con la señorita Morstan? ¿Por qué había ido a la calle Baker? ¿Y qué relación tenía todo esto con el caso del diamante azul? Me pregunté si debía contarle a Holmes sobre esto, pero decidí esperar a que llegáramos a la casa de la señorita Morstan. Cuando el taxi se detuvo frente a su puerta, le pagué al conductor y salí del vehículo. La luz se apagó y luego se encendió de nuevo. Me sentí un poco inquieto, pero seguí llamando hasta que la puerta se abrió y la señorita Morstan me miró con una expresión de sorpresa.

The two I had followed were standing near the entrance, their faces obscured by the shadows. I took a deep breath and approached them, trying to appear nonchalant despite the racing of my heart. As I drew closer, I noticed that they were engaged in a hushed conversation, their voices barely audible over the sound of the wind outside. The clergyman turned to face us, his eyes scanning the room before settling on the pair. He nodded curtly and began to speak, his voice low and soothing. I strained to listen, my ears picking up snippets of their conversation. They were discussing something in hushed tones, their words laced with an air of urgency. I felt a shiver run down my spine as I realized that I had stumbled upon something I wasn't meant to see. The clergyman's eyes flicked towards me, and I froze, wondering if I had been discovered. But he merely nodded again and continued speaking, his words lost on me as I stood there, frozen in uncertainty. The two figures turned to face me, their eyes narrowing slightly as they took in my presence. I felt a surge of fear as I realized that I was trapped, with no clear way to escape. The air in the church seemed to grow thick and heavy, and I could feel the weight of their gaze upon me. I took a step back, my eyes darting towards the door, but it was too late. The clergyman's voice rose, and the two figures began to move towards me, their faces set in determined expressions. I knew then that I had to act fast if I wanted to get out of this situation alive.

en_first_half: “You will remember that I remarked the other day, just before we went into the very simple problem presented by Miss Mary Sutherland, that

en_results: the art of the detective lies in observing the small details which are often overlooked by the untrained eye. It is in these minute particulars that
en_results_raw: the art of the detective lies in observing the small details which are often overlooked by the untrained eye. It is in these minute particulars that the solution to a case often lies, and it is the detective's task to uncover them. In the case of Miss Sutherland, we had a seemingly straightforward problem, but as we delved deeper, we found that nothing was as it seemed. The young woman's story of her missing husband was riddled with inconsistencies, and it was up to us to unravel the tangled threads of her narrative. As we began to investigate, we discovered that Miss Sutherland's husband had been acting strangely in the days leading up to his disappearance, and it was clear that something was amiss. We decided to pay a visit to his business partner, Mr. Leslie Wilson, to see if he could shed any light on the situation. Mr. Wilson was a man of few words, but his demeanor seemed nervous and agitated, and we sensed that he was hiding something. We pressed him for information, but he remained tight-lipped, and it was clear that he was not going to reveal anything without a fight. It was then that I remembered a conversation I had with Inspector Lestrade, who had been involved in a similar case several years ago. He had told me that in cases like this, it was often the smallest detail that proved to be the key to unlocking the truth. I decided to ask Mr. Wilson about a small, seemingly insignificant detail that had been nagging at me since our conversation. I asked him if he had noticed anything unusual on the day of Mr. Sutherland's disappearance, and he hesitated before responding.

En este sentido, la señorita Sutherland nos ha presentado un problema que involucra la probabilidad de que un suceso ocurra en un plazo determinado, lo que nos lleva a considerar la distribución de probabilidad de Poisson, que es una herramienta matemática muy útil para modelar eventos que ocurren con una frecuencia media conocida. Sin embargo, para aplicar esta distribución, es necesario conocer la tasa media de ocurrencia de los eventos, lo que en este caso es lo que nos pide la señorita Sutherland que averigüemos.

es_results_raw: passión por la caza de fantasmas y la lectura de libros de misterio. Según la historia, Hopkins había estado investigando sobre fenómenos paranormales en todo el mundo y había reunido una gran cantidad de evidencia que apoyaba la existencia de la vida después de la muerte. Con el tiempo, su fascinación por el tema se convirtió en una obsesión, y decidió crear la Liga para reunir a personas con intereses similares. La Liga se convirtió en un lugar donde los miembros podían compartir sus experiencias y conocimientos sobre el paranormal, y Hopkins se convirtió en su líder y guía espiritual. A lo largo de los años, la Liga se expandió y se convirtió en una organización secreta, con miembros en todo el mundo que se reunían en secreto para discutir sus hallazgos y planificar sus próximas misiones. Sin embargo, la Liga también había atraído la atención de fuerzas oscuras que no querían que la verdad sobre el paranormal se conociera al público en general. Ahora, con la vacante en la Liga, alguien nuevo iba a tener la oportunidad de unirse a esta organización secreta y descubrir los secretos que se escondían detrás de sus puertas cerradas.

I have been watching the pawnbroker, Mr. Silas, for some time now, and I must say that he seems like a shrewd businessman, always keeping a close eye on his transactions and never showing any emotion, no matter what the customer brings in. I have noticed, however, that he seems particularly nervous on Thursday and Friday evenings, glancing over his shoulder and muttering to himself, which has piqued my interest and made me wonder if he might be involved in something illicit. I have also observed that he has a young woman who comes in every week, always dressed in fine clothes and carrying a small bag, and she always seems to be in a hurry, never staying for more than a few minutes. I am not sure what to make of it, but I thought it was worth mentioning to you, Mr. Holmes, as it might be relevant to our case.

es_results_raw: pay. Es entonces cuando los individuos de clase baja, que han agotado sus recursos durante la semana, acuden a los prestamistas en busca de dinero para solventar sus necesidades básicas. Los prestamistas, por su parte, ofrecen préstamos a intereses exorbitantes, que los deudores no pueden pagar, lo que conduce a una espiral de deuda cada vez más profunda. La noche es el momento ideal para este tipo de actividades ilícitas, ya que la oscuridad y la confusión de la noche permiten a los prestamistas operar con mayor libertad y sin ser detectados por la policía. Los jueves y viernes por la noche son los días más concurridos en este sentido, ya que es justo antes del día de pago, cuando los trabajadores han agotado sus recursos y buscan dinero para solventar sus necesidades. Los prestamistas aprovechan esta situación para ofrecer sus servicios a los desesperados, cobrando intereses astronómicos por sus préstamos. La situación es cada vez más desesperada, y los deudores se ven atrapados en una red de deuda que es difícil de romper. La policía, por su parte, tiene dificultades para detectar y prevenir estas actividades ilícitas, ya que los prestamistas son expertos en eludir la ley y mantener sus operaciones en secreto.

en_first_half: “Well, to my surprise and delight, everything was as right as possible. The table was set out ready for me, and Mr. Duncan Ross was there to see that I got fairly to work. He started me off upon the letter A, and then
en_second_half: he left me; but he would drop in from time to time to see that all was right with me. At two o’clock he bade me good-day, complimented me upon the amount that I had written, and locked the door of the office after me.
en_results: The alphabet was neatly arranged on a large chart in front of me, and I was given a small, delicate pen to practice my handwriting. Mr. Ross stood over me, offering words of encouragement as I carefully formed the loops
en_results_raw: The alphabet was neatly arranged on a large chart in front of me, and I was given a small, delicate pen to practice my handwriting. Mr. Ross stood over me, offering words of encouragement as I carefully formed the loops and curves of the letter A. As I finished, he smiled and nodded in approval, then moved on to the next letter, the B, which I struggled slightly with, but he patiently guided me through it, explaining the correct way to make the distinctive tail. With each letter, my confidence grew, and I found myself becoming more and more engrossed in the task at hand, the soft scratch of the pen on the paper a soothing sound that seemed to wash away all my worries and concerns. As the morning wore on, the room grew quieter, the only sound the soft rustle of the trees outside and the occasional creak of the old wooden floorboards beneath our feet. Mr. Ross seemed to sense my growing fatigue, and suggested a short break, during which I sat back in my chair, feeling a sense of accomplishment wash over me, and gazed out the window, watching as the sun cast its warm rays over the rolling hills and fields beyond, feeling a sense of peace and contentment that I had not felt in a long time. When I returned to my seat, Mr. Ross presented me with a new challenge, the letter C, which I tackled with renewed enthusiasm, my hand moving more surely and confidently over the paper, the letters flowing together in a smooth, flowing script that seemed to dance across the page. As the afternoon wore on, the sun began to set, casting a warm, golden light over the room, and I found myself becoming more and more absorbed in the task, the world outside fading away as I lost myself in the simple, repetitive motion of the pen moving over the paper. It was a feeling I had not experienced in a long time, a sense of calm and focus that seemed to wash away all my worries and concerns, leaving me feeling refreshed and renewed, ready to face whatever challenges lay ahead.

es_results_raw: comenzó a dictarme las palabras, y yo me puse a escribir con la pluma en la mano, sintiendo la suavidad del papel bajo mis dedos. El señor Ross me miraba con una sonrisa en el rostro, como si estuviera orgulloso de mí mismo por haberme dado la oportunidad de aprender. Me recordó que la letra A era una de las más difíciles, pero que con práctica y dedicación podría dominarla en poco tiempo. Mientras trabajaba, escuchaba su voz suave y clara, y me sentía en un estado de concentración total. La habitación estaba tranquila y silenciosa, solo se escuchaba el sonido de la pluma que iba y venía sobre el papel, y el susurro de la respiración del señor Ross. Me sentía como si estuviera en un mundo propio, donde nada más existiera que la letra A y yo. El tiempo parecía pasar volando, y antes de darme cuenta, había terminado la primera página. El señor Ross se acercó a mí y me felicitó por mi progreso, y me dijo que estaba haciendo un excelente trabajo. Me sentí orgulloso de mí mismo, y me di cuenta de que estaba disfrutando de este proceso de aprendizaje. Me pregunté a mí mismo si siempre sería así, si siempre sentiría esta sensación de satisfacción y logro. Pero antes de que pudiera responderme a mí mismo, el señor Ross me interrumpió y me dijo que era hora de pasar a la letra B. Me sentí un poco nervioso, pero también emocionado de enfrentar el desafío. Me pregunté qué me depararía la letra B, y si sería tan fácil como la A. El señor Ross me sonrió y me dijo que la letra B era un poco más complicada, pero que con la práctica y la dedicación, podría superarla también. Me sentí motivado y listo para enfrentar el desafío, y me puse a trabajar en la letra B con la misma determinación y concentración que había tenido con la A.

Cô gái trẻ ngập ngừng một lát, như đang cố gắng tìm kiếm lời giải thích cho những gì đã xảy ra. Sau đó, cô bắt đầu nói, "Tôi... tôi đã thấy một người đàn ông lạ mặt đang theo dõi tôi. Anh ta đã đuổi theo tôi từ ngày trước, và tôi không biết anh ta muốn gì." Holmes nhìn cô một cách nghiêm túc và hỏi tiếp, "Cô có thể mô tả người đàn ông đó không?" Cô gái trẻ cố gắng nhớ lại, nhưng vẻ mặt của cô vẫn còn đầy ảm đạm. "Tôi không thể nhớ rõ, nhưng anh ta có vẻ như là một người đàn ông lớn, với mái tóc đen và đôi mắt lạnh lùng. Anh ta luôn mặc một chiếc áo choàng đen và có một cái gương mặt lạnh lùng." Holmes gật đầu và tiếp tục hỏi, "Cô có thể nhớ được nơi nào anh ta đã theo dõi cô không?" Cô gái trẻ nghĩ một lát, rồi nói, "Tôi nghĩ anh ta đã theo dõi tôi ở khu chợ, và sau đó là ở công viên. Tôi không biết anh ta có thể theo dõi tôi ở đâu nữa." Holmes nhìn cô một cách nghiêm túc và nói, "Cô không cần phải lo lắng, chúng tôi sẽ tìm ra người đàn ông đó và bảo vệ cô." Cô gái trẻ nhìn Holmes một cách tin tưởng, và vẻ mặt của cô bắt đầu sáng lên một chút. Tôi nhìn thấy sự an ủi trong mắt của cô, và biết rằng Holmes sẽ làm mọi thứ để bảo vệ cô.

Me pareció un hombre amable y respetuoso, aunque un poco extraño. Al final, terminé las cartas y se las devolví, y él se las llevó con una sonrisa de agradecimiento. Me preguntó si quería quedarme a tomar un té con él, pero le dije que tenía que irme. Al salir de la oficina, me di cuenta de que había olvidado preguntarle su nombre, y me pregunté si alguna vez volvería a verlo. La experiencia me había parecido extraña, pero también me había hecho sentir un poco más conectado con la gente que trabajaba en la oficina de correos. Al día siguiente, recibí una carta de él, agradeciéndome por mi ayuda y pidiéndome que volviera a trabajar para él en el futuro. Me sorprendió su amabilidad y su generosidad, y me pregunté qué más había detrás de su historia. A medida que pasaban los días, me encontré pensando en él con frecuencia, y me pregunté si alguna vez podría descubrir la verdad sobre su vida y sus motivos. La experiencia me había dejado con más preguntas que respuestas, pero también me había hecho sentir que había encontrado un amigo en un lugar inesperado. Me pregunté si la vida me llevaría a encontrar más personas como él, y si podría aprender algo de su amabilidad y generosidad. La experiencia me había sido única, pero también me había hecho sentir que había aprendido algo valioso sobre la importancia de la amabilidad y la empatía en nuestras vidas. Me pregunté si podría aplicar lo que había aprendido a mi propia vida, y si podría hacer una diferencia en el mundo de alguna manera. La experiencia me había sido un recordatorio de que la amabilidad y la empatía pueden llevarnos a lugares inesperados y a personas increíbles, y que nunca sabemos qué puede surgir de una simple acción de amabilidad. Me sentí agradecido por la experiencia y me pregunté qué más me depararía el futuro.

The silence in the room was oppressive, only broken by the occasional ticking of the grandfather clock in the corner, its rhythmic sound a stark contrast to the turmoil that was brewing in Holmes' mind. He was deep in thought, replaying the events of the past few days, trying to piece together the fragments of a puzzle that seemed to be rapidly falling into place. The game, as they say, was afoot, and Holmes was determined to solve it, no matter the cost. His eyes snapped back into focus as he heard the door to the room open, and he turned to see his trusty sidekick, Dr. Watson, standing in the doorway, a look of curiosity on his face. "Holmes, what's on your mind?" Watson asked, his voice low and even, but with a hint of concern. Holmes' eyes narrowed, and he leaned forward, his elbows on his knees, his hands clasped together in a steeple. "I think I've got it, Watson," he said, his voice barely above a whisper. "I think I know what's been going on." The words hung in the air, and Watson's eyes widened in anticipation as he took a step forward, his eyes fixed on Holmes' face, eager to hear the solution to the mystery that had been plaguing them for so long.

I sat down beside him, and for a moment, we sat in silence, the only sound the gentle rustling of the wind through the grass. It was as if time itself had slowed, and in that moment, I felt a deep connection to this enigmatic figure, a sense of understanding that transcended words. The pipe, still clenched between his teeth, seemed to be the only thing that kept him grounded in reality, a tangible connection to the world around him. I watched as he slowly exhaled a plume of smoke, and his eyes refocused on me, a hint of a smile playing on his lips. "Ah, you're back," he said, his voice low and gravelly, but with a warmth that put me at ease. "I was just lost in thought," he continued, "trying to capture the essence of this place on paper." He gestured to the notebook, and I leaned in to take a closer look, my eyes scanning the pages filled with his hasty scrawls and sketches. As I read through his notes, I began to understand the depth of his passion, the way he saw the world as a tapestry of beauty and wonder, waiting to be unraveled and explored. And in that moment, I knew that I had to know more about this man, to learn from him, and to share in his vision of the world.

"¿Qué sucede, Holmes?" preguntó Watson, notando la tensión en el cuerpo del detective. Holmes levantó la vista, y sus ojos se encontraron con los de Watson, que parecían estar a punto de revelar un secreto. "He estado pensando en el caso de la casa encantada", dijo Holmes, su voz baja y serena. "Sí, ¿qué hay de él?" preguntó Watson, sentándose en la silla que Holmes había ocupado momentos antes. "He estado analizando los detalles, y creo que hay algo que no encaja", continuó Holmes, su mente trabajando a toda velocidad. "¿Qué es?" preguntó Watson, su curiosidad creciendo. "La puerta secreta", dijo Holmes, su voz llena de convicción. "¿La puerta secreta?" repitió Watson, confundido. "Sí, la puerta secreta que supuestamente no existe", explicó Holmes, su rostro serio. "Pero ¿cómo es posible que no exista si todos los demás detalles encajan perfectamente?" preguntó Watson, su mente trabajando para entender la lógica de Holmes. "Eso es lo que quiero averiguar", dijo Holmes, su determinación creciendo. "Vamos a investigar más a fondo", continuó, levantándose de la silla y comenzando a caminar hacia la puerta. "¿Adónde vamos?" preguntó Watson, siguiéndolo. "A la casa encantada", respondió Holmes, su voz firme. "¿Estás seguro de que es una buena idea?" preguntó Watson, notando la oscuridad que se cernía sobre la casa. "Sí, estoy seguro", dijo Holmes, su confianza creciendo. "Vamos a descubrir el secreto de la puerta secreta", continuó, su determinación iluminando su rostro. "Vamos", dijo Watson, siguiéndolo hacia la puerta, listo para enfrentar lo que fuera que se encontraran en la casa encantada.

en_second_half: of keeping her at home and forbidding her to seek the company of people of her own age. But soon he found that that would not answer forever. es_second_half: que busque la compañía de personas de su edad. Pero pronto se dio cuenta de que eso no sería suficiente para siempre. Con la connivencia y la ayuda de su esposa se disfrazó, cubrió esos ojos agudos con gafas tintadas, enmascaró la cara con un bigote y un par de bigotes tupidos, hundió esa voz clara en un susurro insinuante, y doblemente protegido a causa de la corta vista de la chica, se presenta como el señor Hosmer Angel, y aleja a otros amantes al enamorarla él mismo."

But now, with James gone, the weight of that unresolved conflict was crushing, a heavy burden that his sister, Emily, felt acutely, as she struggled to come to terms with the loss of the brother she had always looked up to, and the father she had always tried to please.

Ella asintió con la cabeza y me indicó que subiera a ver las habitaciones. Mientras subía las escaleras, noté que la casa estaba llena de objetos antiguos y curiosos, y me pregunté qué historia podría tener detrás de cada uno de ellos. Al llegar a la habitación que me había indicado la anciana, me sorprendió la vista que se abrió ante mí: una cama grande y cómoda, con una ventana que daba a un jardín lleno de flores silvestres y un río que corría suavemente en el fondo. Me sentí inmediatamente a gusto y le pedí a la anciana que me dijera cuánto costaba la habitación. Ella me miró con una sonrisa astuta y me dijo que era un precio razonable, pero que había una condición: debía compartir la habitación con un huésped extra. Me sorprendió la petición, pero la anciana me aseguró que era un hombre muy amable y que no me molestaría. Le pedí que me lo presentara, y ella me llevó a una habitación contigua donde se encontraba un hombre de aspecto tranquilo y serio, que me estrechó la mano con firmeza y me dijo que se llamaba...

Araştırması sırasında, Bay Holmes'ün karısı ve ailesinin gizli bir geçmişi olduğunu keşfetti. Karısı, zengin bir miras mirasçısıydı ve mirasın büyük bir kısmını alacaktı. Holmes, karısının miras için cinayeti işlediğini düşünüyordu. Ancak, karısının alibi vardı ve cinayetin ardında başka bir sırrın olduğunu düşündü. Araştırması devam ederken, Holmes, cinayetin ardında gizli bir örgütün olduğunu keşfetti. Örgüt, zengin mirasçıları hedef alıyordu ve cinayet, örgütün bir parçası olan bir adamın intiharıydı. Holmes, örgütü çözmek için çalışmaya devam etti ve sonunda örgütü dağıtmayı başardı. Cinayetin ardında gizli bir sırrın olduğunu keşfetti ve adaleti sağladı.

en_results_raw: o'clock when I entered the sitting room, where I found Holmes pacing back and forth in front of the fireplace, his eyes fixed intently on some object that lay on the table. He was so absorbed in his thoughts that he did not even notice my arrival, and it was not until I spoke to him that he turned around and greeted me with a look of distraction. "Ah, Watson, I've been waiting for you," he said, his voice low and urgent. "I've made a most singular discovery, and I believe it may be the key to unraveling the mystery that has been puzzling me all day." He paused, his eyes gleaming with excitement, and then continued, "It appears that our client, Lady Emily, has been hiding a secret, one that could change everything we thought we knew about the case." I raised an eyebrow, intrigued, and asked him to explain, but he merely shook his head and said, "Not now, Watson, not now. First, let us get some dinner, and then we will discuss the details." I nodded, and we went downstairs to the kitchen, where Mrs. Hudson had a hot meal waiting for us. As we ate, I couldn't help but feel a sense of anticipation building inside me, wondering what Holmes had discovered and what it might mean for our investigation.

en_first_half: “Away we went then, and we drove for at least an hour. Colonel Lysander Stark had said that it was only seven miles, but I should think, from the rate that we seemed to go, and from the time that we took, that it must have been nearer twelve. He sat at my side in silence all the time, and I was aware, more than once when I glanced in his direction, that he was looking at me with great intensity. The country roads seem to be not very good in that part of the world, for we lurched and jolted terribly. I tried to look out of the windows to see something of where we were, but they were made of frosted glass, and I could make out nothing save the occasional bright blur
en_second_half: of a passing light. Now and then I hazarded some remark to break the monotony of the journey, but the colonel answered only in monosyllables, and the conversation soon flagged. At last, however, the bumping of the road was exchanged for the crisp smoothness of a gravel-drive, and the carriage came to a stand. Colonel Lysander Stark sprang out, and, as I followed after him, pulled me swiftly into a porch which gaped in front of us. We stepped, as it were, right out of the carriage and into the hall, so that I failed to catch the most fleeting glance of the front of the house. The instant that I had crossed the threshold the door slammed heavily behind us, and I heard faintly the rattle of the wheels as the carriage drove away.
en_results: The trees and hedges whizzed by in a green and brown blur, and I felt a little queasy from the constant jolting of the carriage. I turned my attention back to Colonel Stark, who was still gazing at me with an unnerving intensity. His eyes seemed to bore into my very soul, and I felt a shiver run down my spine. I tried to meet his gaze, but he looked away, his expression unreadable. The silence between us was oppressive, and I found myself fidgeting with my gloves. I glanced at the other passengers, but they were all engrossed in their own thoughts, oblivious to the tension between Colonel Stark and me. The only sound was the creaking of the carriage and the occasional jolt of the wheels on the rough road. As we drove on, the landscape

I glanced at the other passengers, but they were all engrossed in their own thoughts, oblivious to the tension between Colonel Stark and me. The only sound was the creaking of the carriage and the occasional jolt of the wheels on the rough road. As we drove on, the landscape outside seemed to grow more and more desolate, the trees becoming sparser and the fields more overgrown. I wondered where we were headed and why Colonel Stark had brought me here. The mystery was beginning to unnerve me, and I found myself glancing at him more and more frequently, searching for some clue as to what was going on. But his face remained a mask, giving away nothing. The sun was beginning to set, casting long shadows across the landscape, and I felt a sense of unease growing inside me. I was starting to feel trapped, and I wondered if I would ever be able to escape this strange and foreboding place. The carriage seemed to be slowing down, and I caught a glimpse of a large house in the distance. It loomed above the trees, its windows like empty eyes staring back at me. I felt a shiver run down my spine as the carriage drew closer, and I realized that we were finally arriving at our destination. But where were we, and what lay ahead?

es_first_half: "Nos fuimos entonces, y condujimos durante al menos una hora. El coronel Lysander Stark había dicho que sólo eran siete millas, pero yo creía, por la velocidad a la que parecíamos ir, y por el tiempo que tardamos, que debían ser más de doce. Se sentó a mi lado en silencio todo el tiempo, y me di cuenta, más de una vez cuando miré en su dirección, que me estaba mirando con gran intensidad. Parece que las carreteras rurales no son muy buenas en esa parte del mundo, porque dimos unos bandazos y sacudidas terribles. Intenté mirar por las ventanillas para ver algo de dónde estábamos, pero eran de vidrio esmerilado, y no pude distinguir nada más que el borrón ocasional de una luz que pasaba. De vez en
es_second_half: cuando me arriesgaba a hacer algún comentario para romper la monotonía del viaje, pero el coronel sólo respondía con monosílabos, y la conversación pronto decaía. Por fin, sin embargo, los golpes de la carretera fueron sustituidos por la crujiente suavidad de un camino de grava, y el carruaje se detuvo. El coronel Lysander Stark se bajó de él y, mientras yo lo seguía, me arrastró a un porche que se abría ante nosotros. Bajamos, por así decirlo, del carruaje y entramos en el vestíbulo, de modo que no pude echar la más fugaz mirada a la fachada de la casa. En el instante en que crucé el umbral, la puerta se cerró de golpe detrás de nosotros, y oí débilmente el traqueteo de las ruedas mientras el carruaje se alejaba."

en_second_half: upon her dark dress I knew that it was a rich material. en_results_raw: <output>The light danced across her features, illuminating her high cheekbones and full lips, and for a moment, she seemed to be staring right through us. The colonel, still muttering to himself, took a step forward, his eyes fixed on the woman, and I followed suit, my heart beating slightly faster. The woman's gaze lingered on us for a moment, and then she seemed to relax, a small smile playing on her lips. She took a step forward, the lamp held high, and began to make her way towards us, her movements slow and deliberate. As she drew closer, I could see that she was dressed in a long, flowing gown, the fabric shimmering in the light, and her hair was pulled back, revealing a delicate necklace that sparkled around her neck. The colonel, still fumbling with the matches, seemed to be trying to compose himself, but I could sense a hint of excitement in his voice as he spoke, his words barely above a whisper. "Ah, Mrs. Jenkins, I see you're still up," he said, his eyes never leaving the woman's face. Mrs. Jenkins, I assumed, was the woman's name, and she seemed to be a member of the household, but I couldn't help but feel a sense of unease as she drew closer, the lamp casting eerie shadows on the walls around us. The air in the passage seemed to grow thick with tension, and I found myself holding my breath, waiting to see what would happen next. The woman's smile grew wider, and she seemed to be enjoying the moment, her eyes sparkling with amusement, but I couldn't shake the feeling that something was off, that there was more to this encounter than met the eye. As she reached us, the colonel finally managed to produce a match, and he lit it, the flame casting a warm glow over the scene. The woman's smile faltered for a moment, and she looked at the match in the colonel's hand, a flicker of surprise crossing her face, before she regained her composure and smiled again, her eyes never leaving the colonel's face. "Good evening, Colonel," she said, her voice low and husky, and I could sense a hint of something beneath the surface, a hidden current that ran beneath the polite words. The colonel, still holding the match, seemed to be trying to read her expression, but I couldn't help but feel that we were all playing a game, a game of cat and mouse, with secrets and lies lurking just beneath the surface. en_results_raw: The only reason I bother with the newspaper at all is that it's the one place where I can find some semblance of connection to the outside world, a world that seems to be moving forward while I'm stuck in this dingy, cramped flat, surrounded by nothing but dust and the faint scent of decay. I've lost count of the days since I last left these walls, and the only thing that keeps me going is the hope that someone, anyone, will read my letters and respond. The agony column is my only lifeline, a reminder that there are others out there who are just as lost and desperate as I am. I pour over the words, searching for a glimmer of hope, a hint that I'm not alone in this desolate existence. And so, I write, pouring my heart out onto the page, hoping against hope that someone will find me, will hear my plea, and will reach out to me in my time of need.

es_first_half: "Eso está bien. La carta que tengo en mis manos es de Lord St. Simon. Se la leeré, y a
es_second_half: cambio deberá entregar estos papeles y dejarme lo que tenga que ver con el asunto. Esto es lo que dice:
es_results: continuación de la historia, y al hacerlo, me doy cuenta de que es una invitación para asistir a una fiesta
es_results_raw: continuación de la historia, y al hacerlo, me doy cuenta de que es una invitación para asistir a una fiesta en su mansión en el campo. La carta es formal y cortés, pero hay algo en su tono que me hace sentir un poco incómodo. Me pregunto qué podría querer Lord St. Simon de mí, y por qué me ha elegido a mí para que asista a su fiesta. Me imagino que será una noche llena de intrigas y secretos, y mi curiosidad se despierta. Me visto con mi mejor traje y me dirijo a la estación de tren para tomar el tren que me llevará a la mansión de Lord St. Simon. Al llegar, me recibe su mayordomo, un hombre alto y serio que me conduce a la sala de recepción. La habitación está llena de invitados elegantes y ricos, todos charlando y riendo. Me siento un poco fuera de lugar, pero Lord St. Simon se acerca a mí con una sonrisa en su rostro y me da la bienvenida. Me ofrece un vaso de champán y me dice que estoy en su casa, y que espero que disfrute de la noche. Me siento un poco más cómodo, pero todavía no sé qué me trae aquí. Mientras bebo mi champán, miro a mi alrededor y veo a varias personas que parecen estar discutiendo en voz baja. Me acerco a ellos para escuchar, y descubro que están hablando de un asesinato reciente en la región. La señora St. Simon se sentía preocupada por la felicidad de su hija, y no podía evitar preguntarse si el matrimonio sería un éxito. Mientras caminaba de regreso a su casa, se detuvo en la ventana de la tienda de flores para comprar un ramo de rosas para su hija, pensando que tal vez podría ayudar a mejorar su estado de ánimo. Al entrar en la tienda, se encontró con el dueño, un hombre amable y conocido, que le preguntó por qué estaba tan triste. La señora St. Simon se sintió un poco sorprendida por la pregunta, pero decidió contarle a él sobre la discusión entre su hija y su prometido. El dueño de la tienda la escuchó atentamente y le ofreció algunos consejos sabios sobre cómo abordar la situación, y la señora St. Simon se sintió un poco más aliviada después de hablar con él. Al salir de la tienda, se dirigió a su casa, pensando en lo que el dueño le había dicho, y se preguntó si su hija estaría dispuesta a escuchar sus consejos.

You will find it in a small, locked box on your desk, along with a note containing further instructions. I have also arranged for a trusted member of our staff, Mrs. White, to be at your disposal should you require any assistance or guidance. I must stress that the utmost secrecy is paramount in this matter, and I rely on your discretion to maintain the confidentiality of this transaction. I am confident that you will not disappoint me, Mr. Holder, and that you will prove yourself worthy of the trust I have placed in you. I must now take my leave, but I will be keeping a close eye on the situation, and I expect regular updates from you regarding the coronet's safety. I have every faith that you will rise to the challenge and prove yourself a worthy guardian of our family's treasured heirloom. Please, Mr. Holder, do not hesitate to contact me if you have any questions or concerns. I am always available to offer my assistance and guidance. I must stress once again the gravity of this situation and the importance of your role in it. The fate of our family's reputation hangs in the balance, and I rely on you to ensure that the coronet remains safe and secure. I have every confidence that you will not let me down, Mr. Holder, and that you will prove yourself a true and loyal servant of our family. I bid you farewell, and I look forward to hearing from you soon.

en_first_half: “You will find it rather disconnected, I fear, and there may prove to be little relation between the different incidents of which I speak. On the very first day that I was at the Copper Beeches,
en_second_half: Mr. Rucastle took me to a small outhouse which stands near the kitchen door. As we approached it I heard the sharp rattling of a chain, and the sound as of a large animal moving about.
en_results: The house, which was situated in a remote part of the country, I was struck by the peculiar atmosphere that seemed to pervade the entire estate. The trees surrounding the mansion appeared
en_results_raw: The house, which was situated in a remote part of the country, I was struck by the peculiar atmosphere that seemed to pervade the entire estate. The trees surrounding the mansion appeared to lean in, as if they were trying to listen to the conversations of the inhabitants, and the wind carried an eerie whisper that sent shivers down my spine. It was as if the very air was alive with secrets, and I couldn't help but feel that I was being watched by unseen eyes. The butler, Mr. Brown, greeted me with a stern expression, his eyes narrowing slightly as he handed me a key to my room. "You will be staying in the east wing, miss," he said, his voice low and gravelly. I nodded, feeling a sense of trepidation wash over me as I followed him to my quarters. The room was small and Spartan, with a single window that looked out onto the garden. I felt a sense of unease as I gazed out at the overgrown bushes and the tangled vines that seemed to be crawling up the walls. It was as if the very house itself was trying to suffocate me, to trap me in its grasp. I shivered, despite the warmth of the summer air, and turned back to Mr. Brown, who was waiting for me in the doorway. "Is there anything I can get for you, miss?" he asked, his expression unreadable. I shook my head, feeling a sense of foreboding settle over me. "No, thank you, Mr. Brown. I think I'll just rest for a bit." He nodded and turned to leave, but not before I caught a glimpse of something in his eyes that made my heart skip a beat. It was a flicker of something - fear, perhaps, or warning - and it sent a shiver down my spine. I watched him go, feeling a sense of unease that I couldn't shake. As I lay down on the bed, I couldn't help but wonder what lay ahead, and whether I would be able to uncover the secrets that seemed to be hidden behind the Copper Beeches' façade.
